result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Wills, John Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John Thomas Wills in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hughes states matter is resolved.  State states the matter is resolved but DE needs to do inpatient program at St Clare Center but he hasn't done that as yet.  Requests reset for plea/sent.  15CF178 would also track w/this one.  Bond continued in both matters.  State states agreement.  15CF178 - NC.  15CF207 would be dismissed/read-in.  Probation for 24 months w/conditions of costs of $528.00 and DNA sample and restitution as agreed (stip filed).  Jail as condition for 90 days if no treatment done...30 days if treatment is done.  Requests plea today and sentencing out 30 days or so in 15CF178.  Atty Hughes is in agreement.  DE is in agreement.  Atty Hughes enters NC plea to Ct 1 in 15CF178.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  15CF207 is dismissed/read-in.  15CF178 is set for sentencing.
Cover Letter from Attorney Hughes to COC

Defendant John Thomas Wills in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke states DE will waive prelim in both felony cases today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty O'Rourke acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  Bond continued.
May not leave State of WI w/out Court's permission

Pre-trial conference at 07-10-2015 11:30 am.
Return date at 07-23-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant John Thomas Wills in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived. $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  May not leave State of WI w/out court's permission.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 11:30 am.  Return date scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
